block.p: Sarah Elizabeth Kramer, the daughter of Rachel Schwartz and Dr. Peter D. Kramer of Providence, R.I., is to be married there today to Robert Jonathan Fenster, the son of Albert Fenster of New York and the late Mollyanne Marks and the stepson of Gail Sanger. Rabbi Wayne Franklin is to officiate at the Aldrich House, a 19th-century mansion that is used for public events.
The bride, 25, and the bridegroom, 26, met at Harvard, from which they graduated, she cum laude and he summa cum laude.

Sarah Elizabeth Kramer, the daughter of Rachel Schwartz and Dr. Peter D. Kramer of Providence, R.I., is to be married there today to Robert Jonathan Fenster, the son of Albert Fenster of New York and the late Mollyanne Marks and the stepson of Gail Sanger. Rabbi Wayne Franklin is to officiate at the Aldrich House, a 19th-century mansion that is used for public events.
The bride, 25, and the bridegroom, 26, met at Harvard, from which they graduated, she cum laude and he summa cum laude.

The bride writes for a technology blog on the SciFi Channel's Web site. Until April, she was an editorial assistant at Cond√© Nast Portfolio, a business magazine for which she now is a freelance writer.

Her father, a psychiatrist in Providence, is a clinical professor at Brown University School of Medicine. He is the author of six books, including ''Listening to Prozac'' (Viking Press, 1993). Her mother is the vice president for strategic planning at Lifespan, a health care company in Providence.

The bridegroom finished his second year of medical school at Cornell last month. He is a fellow in a neuroscience laboratory at Rockefeller University. He received a second bachelor's degree, in English literature, from Cambridge University.

His stepmother is a partner in Proskauer Rose, the law firm in New York. His father is a partner in Kaye Scholer, the law firm in New York, where he is a chairman of the corporate and finance department. The bridegroom's mother was the corporate counsel at Beth Israel Medical Center in New York.
